0:
--------------------
Text: Marathon (Demotic Greek: Μαραθώνας, "Marathónas"; Attic/Katharevousa: Μαραθών , "Marathṓn") is a town in Greece, the site of the battle of Marathon in 490 BC, in which the heavily outnumbered Athenian army defeated the Persians.
Triplets:<Marathon
1:
--------------------
Text: Marathon, Greece:  The tumulus or burial mound (Greek" Τύμβος, tymbos", tomb) of the 192 Athenian dead, also called the "Soros", which was erected near the battlefield, remains a feature of the coastal plain.
Triplets:<Marathon
2:
--------------------
Text: Marathon, Greece:  The Tymbos is now marked by a marble memorial stele and surrounded by a small park.
